reviews.review_msg: Took the course in Summer 2020 with Marco. He is engaging, friendly, and clearly explains what is expected from you. I was scared of taking this course as writing is not my strength but taking it with Marco makes it worthwhile.
AMAZING PROF!!! HE MADE ME ENJOY BUS 217W

Marco bought us Timbits and food! (5/5). Marco is an amazing prof and tried to make the content really enjoyable and easy to understand. He really made sure everyone understood the concepts and was always available outside of class.

I took BUS 217W with Marco and do not regret it one bit. He is one of the most helpful and accessible profs I've come across at SFU. The content is pretty much dry but the course layout and outline change the game. Marco ensures that every student picks up the concept he is trying to convey and aids you in its execution throughout the course.

Marco is a great prof and I'd highly recommend taking 217 with him. I found the content very dry, but he made it must more enjoyable. He is super approachable and will always make sure that anybody who reaches out for extra help leaves with the information they wanted to know.

Marco always makes class so much fun. He's really young so he is able to relate to us. Always says jokes and makes class fun. I heard BUS217 with other profs can be a real drag... This was my favorite class all semester for sure!
Marco is a funny and amazing guy. Insightful and charismatic . You won't regret taking his class!

Really don't understand the negative reviews about Colleen. She's very chill and understanding with students, and definitely not a hard grader at all if you follow the instructions carefully. I flew through this course just by following her guidelines. Definitely can be a bit more organized but she's caring and wants to help students do well.
tough grader and unreasonable
She just doesn't want to give grades to people. The most unfair teacher I have ever seen in my life.

Darelle is passionate about what she teaches. Her lectures are interesting and she tries to engage with the class as much as possible. The class is challenging however, the TA's and Darelle give lots of good feedback to help us improve. If you put in the time and effort and visit Darelle during office hours you can get a good mark in this course.

One of the best lecturers Ive had at Beedie. Took the time to engage with the class and was very personable. she left very good feedback and was super helpful in office hours and through emails. Would highly recommend her for any class and especially BUS217, you wont regret having her. 10/10

Took Darelle's class for 217 and she was honestly so delightful! Probably the most engaging prof I've had for online classes which was amazing. Marked difficultly but within what would be expected for 217. I wish she was more understanding of grade appeals though as some things seemed to contradict things she had said previously.

I haven't taken Darelle before in any classes, but I know she's teaching the upcoming 217W Fall 2020. I took her for the passport class and those who didn't participate were notified that she was "disappointed" in us. Seems like she's a tough grader...

Mr. Amburgey is one of the best caring, friendly, and respectful professors you will ever have at SFU. If he is teaching any course at SFU, I recommend you to take it with him. He will listen and sympathize with you. It is very easy to reach out to him and ask him questions about the course material or assignments; he loves to help his students.

Brent is a super nice and caring prof. He gives a great amount of detailed feedback and is very open with what he shares. His lectures were also engaging and helpful. Brent's class averages and curve, however, tend to be higher than other sections - which may impact your grade. Would recommend.
Solid choice for 217. Id recommend taking 217 with him. He is a nice guy and cares about his students

Brent is an incredible prof, he cares about his students and is super chill. I wish he was teaching BUS360, I would definitely take it with him. He is such a nice guy and is always willing to help his students and wants the best for his students! Honestly, follow the rubric and you will do fine in this class. SUPER CHILL GUY.
Brent is incredible at explaining the concepts all business students will need. Grading is hard, but for individual projects, you get two submissions where you can implement feedback. Great Prof!

The nature of the class itself is supposed to be difficult; no matter what prof you have, the TAs will mark hard. With that being said, Brent is an amazing professor that actually cares about his students. Although papers were marked hard, he made sure to give clear feedback. If you incorporate the feedback, youll do great. Best 217 prof out there
This guy makes the entire course harder than math. Tough grader for a total useless course that shouldnt be necessary.

Brent is amazing. He makes the transition to remote learning a lot easier. Although he doesn't give clear instructions for assignments but you have 2 chances to submit it again. He also gives valuable feedback to improve. He is one of my top 3 favourite profs at SFU so far.
horrible professor, never help his student even there's unfair in-group members number, take him if you wanna ruin your GPA!

Totally ineffective lectures. Assignments and rubric are vague. Proper assignments should have all you need in the rubric or assignment description. Kinda funny but goes on ill informed political rants. Streams videos from his cave.

I found Robin was extremely disorganized with his lecture material, canvas structure, and syllabus as well as due dates! He seems caring and is very funny which helps make the class more fun but grading is extremely tough and very little things will dock you big points. However, this may just be the TAs.

Michelle is a really sweet teacher that obviously wants her students to succeed. The course content was insanely boring but she tried to make it more interactive with group activities and projects - you'll be working with them for a large portion of the course. Individual written assignments are hard!! - Put time into it!
Michele is very organized and cares about her students. She tries to be timely with her markings and always keep her students posted.
Tough grader but very caring towards each of her student's needs.

Good prof with interesting lectures. Tough grading, but that is just the nature of the course. With that said, not that hard to beat the curve if you put some effort in. This course definitely helped with writing in a business setting.

Recommended to take. He's caring and gives helpful feedback, but he grades very tough. Make sure you're on a strong team, otherwise you might end up writing a 4 page paper solo. Good luck, and be ready to defend every sentence you write.

Well, now the course is monopolized by only two options (the school's schedule arrangement is ridiculous) for BUS217, I'd go with Henry. He's approachable and willing to help, and his lectures are more engaging. Workload is still heavy, but manageable if you keep up.

He is OK. The assignments grading is fair. The course covers the basics well but doesn't go much beyond that. Feedback is helpful but sometimes brief. It's a useless and boring course if you want steady progress without surprises.
This course is useless for sure! I am so lucky that dropped Ilia's section and changed into his one, not bad but it's better to not listen some someone's useless news haha
So much writing material and unnecessary assignments.

Henry is a horrible prof, I would avoid at all cost. His assignment instructions are always extremely unclear, leaving students left to figure it out themself. This is his first class at SFU and acts like he knows everything. Do yourself a favour and choose any other prof.

He was enthusiastic about teaching at Beedie for the first time this semester but didn't tell the students about specific guidelines and grading standards for the assignments; the TA was particularly harsh and ridiculously picky, and also his cases were difficult compared to other instructors.

Jerome is one of those teachers that doesn't believe a 100% grade is possible. The assignment feedback is poor quality, and the grading is based more on formatting rather then the written content itself. The lectures are very boring and are hard to watch even if you really try to.

Doesn't post grade averages for assignments which sucks. Course was very lecture heavy. He is by far the most unreasonably difficult marker I have had at SFU. I would not recommend taking BUS217W with Jerome unless you want to work extremely hard get a decent looking grade% and somehow end up with an awful letter grade.
Extremely unreasonable grader. Avoid if possible.

She ended up giving us 10 days to do the last assignment instead of 7 and I found that very helpful! I think she and TAs really want students to do well but the rubrics (that she did not create) are strict. Easy marks from weekly In the News and don't fall behind with readings. Actually go to class.

Luana was a mid professor. She basically assigns readings and expects students to understand how to improve their writing based on those articles. She doesn't really teach much. Every class there's an in class group assignment and an individual assignment due at the end of tutorial.  Also she's pretty hard to reach outside of class.

Distance between class low and high was oddly tight on every assignment. Suspicious of teacher and ta using AI to grade; feedback was always the same and provided no help for the digital portfolio assignment, which I did average on, because of the vagueness. Mundane inclass group assignments. Tutorial assignments were always a time crunch.

She is a great professor who cares about her students and made lectures engaging! Lots of assignments in class and tutorials, but it made the workload at home much lighter because there was only a couple assignments to do outside of class. I definitely liked her class even though it was a little tough

I was in the pilot class where all assignments (except midterm/final paper) were all done in-class. I enjoyed her lectures - they were simple and gave us half of the class to do group discussions/work. Her lectures are also interactive and engaging. She can mark pretty harshly but she uses it to give us more room for improvement.
Not a clear grading rubric for her assignments. Quite easy to do well if you actually do the homework. She comes 10 minutes late every class.

Terrible prof. She went on vacation for 2 weeks in the middle of the semester. She doesn't seem to care about her students success as her assignments and instructions are super vague. Barely remember anything valuable being learned in this class.

Luana is a kind person but not the best prof :(( Her lectures generalize the information you need to do well on assignments and the grading is super vague and it's difficult to ask for clarification as TAs expect you to basically learn through trial and error. Honestly idk if it was her or the course but this was super hard to do well in :(((
Hardly taught anything, assignments were full of logistical errors, and halfway through the semester she left for Italy for a surgery and the rest of the classes were done online.

The course content is very useful for business students. However, Luana was hard to reach at times especially near the end of the course. Lots of grading inconsistencies and unclear instructions (grading mostly done by TAs). At times the class was extremely boring too. However, if you are a good writer, this class will be easier for you.

Luana was a pretty good professor. Her teaching style was fine but grading was inconsistent and unclear at times. She is kind and approachable, but grading is the biggest issue. Received a B with fairly average effort.

People will complain that her assignments are not clear and grading is biased but I think shes pretty clear just go to lectures, shes also available for help lots. Her class wasnt my favourite, but I think it was more a content issue that a prof issue. However, depends a lot on TAs, as graded almost all on assignments & they marked them all :(

Nice person, bad professor. Very interesting person to talk to but don't count on her to actually teach you things. Kind of attractive as well so it's always a plus but can also be a DISTRACTION <333333333 #Italy

Luana cares about her students and wants them to succeed. Grades really depend on the TA but if you seek office hours and start your assignments early you'll be okay. I do wish that there was more direction in this class, especially the first half, but this class is meant to be challenging. Overall a decent experience.

Luana is certainly an interesting prof. I really do respect her as a person and think that she has a good heart and wants the best for her students. Luana was a new prof and we were one of her first classes at SFU. The course page was uploaded late and she was also always late. Although she is a caring person she is just not a good instructor.
I feel lucky to meet Michael this semester. He made the tough BUS217 vivid and he let you work for you grade.

Michael is nice. He comes from English faculty and probably is a little bit strict in grammar. But this is a good thing since you will benefit a lot especially in english professional writing. This course is tough, but Michael makes the course at least not that boring. His mark is fair.

Susan is seriously sooo kind, but this class was a mess. Our TA showed up to two tutorials TOTAL and therefore our grades were based off few assignments. This class' gradings genuinely made me want to rip my hair out and cry at every opportunity. SOOOO blessed I got this grade #godblessthecurve #nevertouching217Wagainandimgratefulforthat
This course is a joke

Welcome to BUS217w, where the professor yaps about nothing for the first half of class, and you get an assignment with confusing or no instructions for the latter half. I Hope you're ready to receive 70% on every assignment/project with 0 explanation and feedback!

Terrible prof and terribly structured course. Grading rubrics were unclear, and feedback was not given on assignments, despite the last assignment supposedly being based on “improving” our work based on “feedback”. Often the TA, Susan, and the slides were all contradicting each other on guidelines. Final project was also due in the middle of exams.

Final assignment is critiquing past assignments based on critical feedback from ta but we aren't provided with any feedback even day prior to the assignment being due. Also she says class assignments that "arent for marks" but she changes her mind after it is marked and makes it for marks.

Instructions on what is due and what doesn't have to be done is unclear leaving students wondering whether or not it will count towards marks in class/tutorial assignments. TA has very tough marking rubric where nobody gets top marks and average is close to 60% - 75%. Group assignments are fine. Just don't expect to get top marks.

This prof is quite nice to her students but has zero capability to maintain an organized outline. She has no idea how the TA is marking and it seems the marking criteria is completely different from TA to Prof.

Avoid her class at all costs. She is extremely disorganized and never responds to emails. Her lectures are boring and you learn absolutely nothing. She never communicates with the TA and most of the time they are on different pages when it comes to assignments and marking. We also went 8 weeks without a tutorial. She's very nice and caring however.

This class is disorganized. The Canvas was released late, and materials were often uploaded last minute or during class, wasting time. She's bad at keeping the TA accountable, making it hard to get help. The course is meant to be engaging, but her teaching style is scattered and dull. Poor organization and ineffective lectures—avoid if possible.
